data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls have lost one of the major pillars of the latest rally – TDS
data.text: Gold price is building on its recovery from four-week troughs of $1,860. Still, buyers seem to lack conviction, economists at TD Securities report.

data.title: Surfing the Waves with Gregor Horvat: EURUSD, AUDUSD, GBPUSD, XAUUSD, DAX, CADJPY & More!
data.text: In today's advanced #ElliottWave analysis, Gregor dives into the five most interesting opportunities for the week ahead! Watch how he analyses #equities, #FXMajors, and #Commodities and discover how he applies EW principles to come up with his amazing forecasts!

data.title: Gold Rallies as Fed Chair Powell Sticks to Post FOMC Rhetoric
data.text: Spot gold's rally has seen it take out the weekly high at $1885 with $1900 now in sight. Will Fed speakers spoil the party?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast XAU/USD – Powell Said Just Enough to Stop Price Slide Ahead of Next Week's CPI Data
data.text: The gold market and the Fed are zeroing in on next Tuesday's U.S. consumer inflation report.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD clings to gains near weekly top amid weaker US Dollar
data.text: Gold price is building on its bounce from the $1,860 area, or a one-month low touched earlier this week and gains traction for the third straight day on Wednesday. The momentum lifts the XAU/USD to a fresh weekly high, around the $1,886 region during the first half of the European session and is sponsored by a combination of factors.

data.title: XAU/USD: Incomplete Triple Zigzag Hints at Further Growth
data.text: It is assumed that in the long term, a triple zigzag pattern is formed for gold, which consists of five main sub-waves Ⓦ-Ⓧ-Ⓨ-Ⓧ-Ⓩ. Perhaps the first two sub-waves Ⓦ-Ⓧ have already been formed, and the third sub-wave Ⓨ is under development.

data.title: XAU/USD Struggles to Stabilise
data.text: Gold steadies ahead of Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech later today. On the daily chart, last April's sell-off zone around 1950 has proved to be a tough barrier to crack.

data.title: XAUUSD Incomplete Triple Zigzag Hints at Further Growth
data.text: It is assumed that a triple zigzag pattern is formed for gold in the long term. This consists of sub-waves Ⓦ-Ⓧ-Ⓨ-Ⓧ-Ⓩ.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD sellers still have the upper hand
data.text: Gold price attempts another run toward the $1,900 mark. Nevertheless, XAU/USD bulls seem to lack conviction on the road to recovery, as FXSTreet's Dhwani Mehta notes.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD prints three-day uptrend beyond $1,870 support – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) remains firmer for the third consecutive day as buyers cheer a sustained rebound from the short-term key support surrounding $1,870 amid sluggish markets. Adding strength to the XAU/USD rebound could be the US Dollar's lack of momentum, as well as a pullback in the Treasury bond yields.

data.title: Gold Futures: Rebound looks limited
data.text: Open interest in gold futures markets dropped for the fourth session in a row on Tuesday, this time by just 785 contracts according to preliminary readings from CME Group. Volume, instead, resumed the uptrend and went up by around 16.2K contracts.

data.title: Is Gold Set for a ‘Sympathy Bounce' Towards 1900?
data.text: It was a tough end to the week for gold bugs which saw the yellow metal plunge 5% from its YTD high. Yet support was found just above the 50-day EMA, and two inverted hammers (with slight bullish closes) show that bearish momentum is waning.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes $1,880 as investors digest Powell's guidance and Biden's SOTU
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is aiming to capture the immediate resistance of $1,880.00 in the Asian session. The precious metal rebounded after dropping to near $1870.00 and is expected to add gains ahead as the risk appetite of the market participants is improving.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls eye 50% mean reversion
data.text: The Gold price finished the day pretty much unchanged amid a US Dollar which was mixed across the board, pushed and pulled over the comments from the Federal Reserve's Jerome Powell who was speaking at The Economic Club of Washington, D.C. Signature Even.

data.title: Gold Price Hangs Tough as US Dollar Dominates Proceedings. Where to for XAU/USD?
data.text: The gold price has mostly ignored the turmoil of US Dollar movements upending other markets this week as the Federal Reserve's rate path provides the impetus for volatility.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD stays on bumpy bearish road on mixed Federal Reserve talks
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) stays defensive around $1,870, after the last two days' failed attempt to rebound from $1,860, as market sentiment stays sluggish amid mixed signals from the Federal Reserve and the geopolitical front. Adding confusion to the metal traders' minds could be the lack of major data/events.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast XAU/USD – Hovering Near Session Low as Treasury Yields Surge
data.text: Treasury yields ticked higher even after Powell suggested that the Fed is making headway in its efforts to tamp down inflation.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD firms at around $1870 as the USD turns almost flat
data.text: Gold price clings to gains on Tuesday, though it remains below Monday's high of 1881.31, ahead of Fed's Chair Jerome Powell's comments in an event at the Economic Club of Washington at 17:40 GMT. Hence, the XAU/USD is exchanging hands at 1874.20 after hitting a daily low of 1865.81 at the time of writing.

data.title: Gold, Silver, Palladium – Precious Metals Rebound From Multi-Week Lows
data.text: Treasury yields pulled back from recent highs, providing additional support to precious metals.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast – Gold Markets Bounce Slightly
data.text: Gold markets have bounced a bit during the trading session on Tuesday to show signs of resiliency. Quite frankly, gold markets have been absolutely pummeled so it should not be a huge surprise to see market participants take a bit of a break.
